title.english: The Vampire Dies in No Time

description:
Legendary vampire hunter Ronaldo finds an unlikely (and unwilling) ally in Draluc, the world’s weakest vampire who turns to dust at the slightest attack. Together they’re in for more hilarious misadventures than you can shake a stake at, including enemy vampires, axe-wielding editors, and other pains in the neck.

(Source: Funimation)
synonyms: เจ้าแวมไพร์ พันธุ์ตายไว

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Vampire
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a vampire.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Police
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of law enforcement officers.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Video Games
tags.description: Centers around characters playing video games.

tags.name: Nun
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a nun.

Fukuyama released his debut music album "Romantic World 31" on his birthday (November 26) in 2009, his second album "Love Letters 2: Paris Romantic" on July 21, 2010, his third album "Fukuyama Jun, Ai wo Utau!" on May 25, 2011, and his fourth album "Love Letter 3 ~Matsuri no Kuni de~" on May 22, 2013. He also appeared in a 2009 romantic comedy movie Fujoshi Kanojo in a cameo role.

Sofía Huerta is a Mexican voice actress.

[Instagram](https://Instagram.com/fabioreallyfast/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/FabioCamposDub) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/fabio.campos.3511)

Fábio Campos is a Brazilian actor, voice actor, dubbing director and musician.

As dubbing director, he has worked at DuBrasil since 2014, and is also a professor in the studio's dubbing course. He also works as a musician, being a bassist in the group Speed ​​Bullets Trio.

__Non-Anime Roles:__
~!- Takeda Takahashi (Mortal Kombat X)

- Saber (Mobile Legends: Bang Bang)

- Peter Porker / Spider-Ham and Two-Gun Kid (LEGO Marvel Super Heroes 2)
- El Chavo del Ocho (El Chavo video game)
- Joshua "Josh" Wilson / White Josh (Crazy Ex-Girlfriend)
!~

__Aki Hata__ is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer and member of the music production team [Q-MHz](https://anilist.co/staff/156926/QMHz).

__[Website](http://kandajohn.jp/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/johnkanda_pgr)__

__John Kanda__ is a Japanese composer, guitarist and member of five-piece rock band [PENGUIN RESEARCH](https://anilist.co/staff/120093/PENGUIN-RESEARCH)
Hiromi Inoue is a producer and advertiser.
